title: High-throughput imaging of heterogeneous cell organelles with an X-ray laser
title_cn: X射线激光对异质细胞细胞器的高通量成像
abstract: We overcome two of the most daunting challenges in single-particle diffractive imaging: collecting many high-quality diffraction patterns on a small amount of sample and separating components from mixed samples. We demonstrate this on carboxysomes, which are polyhedral cell organelles that vary in size and facilitate up to 40% of Earth's carbon fixation. A new aerosol sample-injector allowed us to record 70,000 low-noise diffraction patterns in 12 min with the Linac Coherent Light Source running at 120 Hz. We separate different structures directly from the diffraction data and show that the size distribution is preserved during sample delivery. We automate phase retrieval and avoid reconstruction artefacts caused by missing modes. We attain the highest-resolution reconstructions on the smallest single biological objects imaged with an X-ray laser to date. These advances lay the foundations for accurate, high-throughput structure determination by flash-diffractive imaging and offer a means to study structure and structural heterogeneity in biology and elsewhere.
abstract_cn: 我们克服了单颗粒衍射成像中最艰巨的两个挑战：在少量样品上收集许多高质量的衍射图，并从混合样品中分离出组分。我们在羧基小体上证明了这一点，羧基小体是大小不一的多面体细胞器，可促进多达40％的地球固碳。新型的气溶胶样品注入器使我们可以在120赫兹的直线加速器相干光源下在12分钟内记录7万个低噪声衍射图样。我们直接从衍射数据中分离出不同的结构，并表明在样品输送过程中尺寸分布得以保留。我们使相位检索自动化，并避免了由缺失模式引起的重建伪像。迄今为止，我们在使用X射线激光成像的最小单个生物物体上实现了最高分辨率的重建。这些进展为通过闪光衍射成像确定准确的高通量结构奠定了基础，并为研究生物学及其他领域的结构和结构异质性提供了一种手段。

title: Measuring the temporal structure of few-femtosecond free-electron laser X-ray pulses directly in the time domain
title_cn: 直接在时域中测量几飞秒自由电子激光X射线脉冲的时间结构
abstract: Short-wavelength free-electron lasers are now well established as essential and unrivalled sources of ultrabright coherent X-ray radiation. One of the key characteristics of these intense X-ray pulses is their expected few-femtosecond duration. No measurement has succeeded so far in directly determining the temporal structure or even the duration of these ultrashort pulses in the few-femtosecond range. Here, by deploying the so-called streaking spectroscopy technique at the Linac Coherent Light Source, we demonstrate a non-invasive scheme for temporal characterization of X-ray pulses with sub-femtosecond resolution. This method is independent of photon energy, decoupled from machine parameters, and provides an upper bound on the X-ray pulse duration. We measured the duration of the shortest X-ray pulses currently available to be on average no longer than 4.4 fs. Analysing the pulse substructure indicates a small percentage of the free-electron laser pulses consisting of individual high-intensity spikes to be on the order of hundreds of attoseconds.
abstract_cn: 短波自由电子激光器现已确立为超亮相干X射线辐射不可或缺的重要来源。这些强烈的X射线脉冲的主要特征之一是其预期的几飞秒持续时间。到目前为止，还没有任何测量方法能够成功地直接确定这些超短脉冲的时间结构，甚至在几飞秒范围内的持续时间。在这里，通过在直线加速器相干光源上部署所谓的条纹光谱技术，我们展示了一种非侵入性方案，用于以亚飞秒分辨率对X射线脉冲进行时间表征。该方法与光子能量无关，与机器参数解耦，并提供了X射线脉冲持续时间的上限。我们测量了目前可用的最短X射线脉冲的持续时间，平均时间不超过4.4＆fs。分析脉冲的子结构可以发现，由单个高强度尖峰组成的自由电子激光脉冲中，只有一小部分处于数百个阿秒的数量级。

title: A generalization of the entropy power inequality to bosonic quantum systems
title_cn: 熵幂不等式到玻色子量子系统的推广
abstract: In most communication schemes, information is transmitted via travelling modes of electromagnetic radiation. These modes are unavoidably subject to environmental noise along any physical transmission medium, and the quality of the communication channel strongly depends on the minimum noise achievable at the output. For classical signals, such noise can be rigorously quantified in terms of the associated Shannon entropy and it is subject to a fundamental lower bound called the entropy power inequality. However, electromagnetic fields are quantum mechanical systems, so the quantum nature of the information carrier cannot be neglected—especially in low-intensity signals—and many important results derived within classical information theory require non-trivial extensions to the quantum regime. Here, we prove one possible generalization of the entropy power inequality to quantum bosonic systems. The impact of this inequality in quantum information theory is potentially large and some relevant implications are considered in this work.
abstract_cn: 在大多数通信方案中，信息是通过电磁辐射的传播模式传输的。这些模式不可避免地会受到任何物理传输介质的环境噪声的影响，并且通信通道的质量很大程度上取决于输出端可达到的最小噪声。对于经典信号，可以根据相关的香农熵严格量化此类噪声，并且该噪声会受到称为熵幂不等式的基本下限的限制。但是，电磁场是量子力学系统，因此不能忽略信息载体的量子性质（尤其是在低强度信号中），并且经典信息理论中得出的许多重要结果都要求对量子态进行非平凡的扩展。在这里，我们证明了熵功率不等式对量子玻色子系统的一种可能的推广。这种不平等对量子信息理论的影响可能很大，并且在本文中考虑了一些相关的含义。

title: Nonlinear π phase shift for single fibre-guided photons interacting with a single resonator-enhanced atom
title_cn: 单纤维导引光子与单个共振器增强原子相互作用的非线性π相移
abstract: Realizing a strong interaction between individual photons is an important objective of research in quantum science and technology. It requires an optical medium in which light experiences a phase shift that depends nonlinearly on the photon number. Once the additional two-photon phase shift reaches π, such an ultra-strong nonlinearity could enable the implementation of high-fidelity quantum logic operations. However, the nonlinear response of standard optical media is orders of magnitude too weak. Here, we demonstrate a fibre-based nonlinearity that realizes an additional two-photon phase shift close to the ideal value of π. We employ a whispering-gallery-mode resonator, interfaced by an optical nanofibre, where the presence of a single rubidium atom in the resonator mode results in a strongly nonlinear response. We show that this results in entanglement of initially uncorrelated incident photons. This demonstration of a fibre-integrated, ultra-strong nonlinearity is a decisive step towards photon-based scalable quantum logics.
abstract_cn: 实现各个光子之间的强相互作用是量子科学和技术研究的重要目标。它需要一种光学介质，在该介质中，光经历的相移非线性地取决于光子数。一旦额外的两光子相移达到＆＃960 ;，这种超强非线性就可以实现高保真量子逻辑运算。但是，标准光学介质的非线性响应太弱了几个数量级。在这里，我们演示了基于光纤的非线性，该非线性实现了接近理想值＆＃960;的附加双光子相移。我们采用耳语画廊模式谐振器，通过光学纳米纤维对接，谐振器模式中单个rub原子的存在会导致强烈的非线性响应。我们表明，这会导致最初不相关的入射光子发生纠缠。光纤集成的超强非线性的演示是迈向基于光子的可伸缩量子逻辑的决定性一步。
